review: Garbage. Watch out, confluence will randomly not save updates, and you'll have to do all over again.
If you have a phone with a large screen, uninstall this divergent product and use the web. They didn't even include the navigation menu in this app.

Slow and unresponsive. Very poor ui/ux. I'm a fan of confluence on the Web but this app is a terrible implementation of a great product. It better not to offer an app at all than ruin a great product. For instance, why do I need to 'tap to load' a list of child pages on a parent placeholder page. In what world would I not want to automatically see the list of child pages? OK, when I do tap to load, then it may or may not load said children.
With over 4 minutes spent trying to log on to the app and waiting for close to 5 more minutes to load and access my team work, I'm kinda not encouraged.

I wrote this in the Jira app as well but it applies even more here, using Chrome to access confluence and Jira is significantly better then using this app. A good example of one of the many missing features is drafts. Drafts do not sync which means that you have to publish anytime you make changes if you want to save them. The app eats up a lot of screen space that the website does not. At least on the website especially if you use desktop mode, you can change the sizing to meet your needs.
I'm getting lost on surfing it, hard to find teamworks overall good and useful, need time to adapt
the mobile website is better, and considering it will launch you to the website for most operations I'm not exactly sure what the app is for anyways.

It takes special skill to create a worse version of the website, but atlassian have managed it üëçüëç. The app is bare bones and functionality is infuriating. Commenting on pages, navigation after leaving the app for a second, hierarchy while responding to a question on the wiki ... everything made me want to reach for the laptop. Which is what I'll probably do from now on. UX is important. Please invest in it!!!

The app is useful to review articles. What I miss is the integration of my templates. Unfortunately I have no option to select the existing templates. It would be awesome if you would improve the usage of templates. For example when I'm sitting in a meeting and just have my smartphone, I would love to use the meeting note from Confluence but I only have the plain page for my notes.

Great tool for handling Confluence from my Android mobile üì±. I love the simplicity of the UI in contrast with the web app. I approve of the choice of not loading everything at once (child topics for instance) but allowing the user to load them on demand, which saves bandwidth and improves loading speed. It still get sluggish from time to time, which is the reason I don't give it 5 starts, but I know the Atlassian team is working hard on making it even better üí™!

This app lacks way too many features compared to the desktop version. It's not even possible to add tables to a page. In addition the formatting of headers etc. is way off making it difficult to have a uniform design if people edit pages from mobile and desktop devices. Come on Atlassian! The app is in this state for too long now.

This is a great app for viewing your documents. Actually, I like viewing my documents here way better than the onenote app (slow, scrolling pages doesn't provide you a fix view, etc). The only thing for now I want to see in feature updates is the ability to edit same way we can online. For example, via online you can add macros but not in mobile app. I know atlassian will make this app better. :)
ras4vb: Hi Merrell, We just released a new mobile editor with more similar features as the web editor, such as formatting, mentioning, and more. You can give it a try by creating a new page through the app. Please let us know how we can continue to improve the experience and help you get work done!

review: I can't even view pages without the app freezing up 50+% of the time and trying to edit a page is an absolute nightmare and does all kinds of crazy stuff with white space and backspacing and... well... it is just 100% unusable unless your goal is to fix a typo in a single word and even then... good luck... the cursor doesn't go where I tap. Note 10+ absolutely unusable.
ras4vb: Please check if you have Grammarly enabled. Grammarly + Samsung keyboard has issues and Samsung has issued an update for their keyboard. For more details on this issue please see: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Grammarly-Issue-for-Confluence-amp-Jira-Mobile-Samsung-Users/ba-p/1997726

review: Well and truly broken on a Samsung S22. Whilst typing comments onto a page it begins to randomly insert extra whitespace whilst typing, I'm finding it Infuriating and completely impractical. The same is true for its sister app jira. As others have said its missing key features that would make Confluence accessible from your pocket like the ability you search a page or filter a table. The rendering of large tables of data is also something not to be desired on a mobile experience.
ras4vb: Please check if you have Grammarly enabled. Grammarly + Samsung keyboard has issues and Samsung has issued an update for their keyboard. For more details on this issue please see: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Grammarly-Issue-for-Confluence-amp-Jira-Mobile-Samsung-Users/ba-p/1997726

review: Good and expensive program for the time being with me I should be able to notify good and prosperity thanks for your help and day to notify me when I get My opportunity
How long does this damn thing need to just show child page list?

I can't log in anymore. Since a few weeks ago I cannot access my cloud confluence (got connection errors). I tried clearing cache, which didn't work. I tried clearing storage and now it won't log in. The error: "We couldn't log you in. Network timeout. Check your internet connection." I tried on WiFi and on Cellular. Internet works. But the App doesn't :-(
ras4vb: Hi, were you able to log into https://id.atlassian.com/ successfully in your browser on your device? Let us know how it worked out either by filing a feedback or by emailing confluence-mobile@atlassian.com . Thanks!

review: A nice start, but the new desktop experience is still much better. If you compare the new formatting to this mobile version, it needs a good amount of polish still. Text spacing is off, iframe embeds don't work. Looking forward to this getting more updates and improvements.

Lackluster versus actual website. The features are severely stripped down and you can't specify what type of pages you are creating. Also the editor is clunky and the UI isn't as intuitive. I'm disappointed in this one, Atlassian. :(

Confluence is the hotness for data science projects. Lots of integrations make it support easy to document as you go. No more Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoints, and Jupyter notebooks floating around in random file systems on the cloud or somebody's laptop. Everything lives in Confluence and we link out to Box, GitHub, JIRA, Jupyter, where needed. It even supports markdown, so you can just document in your code and push to a page. Our clients can comment on our work, to give timely feedback.
ras4vb: Hi Ramon, thanks for sharing! We're so excited to hear that Confluence is helping your team move data science projects forward. Our team here would love to hear more about your experience. If you have time, would love to chat. Please feel free to directly book time on my calendar http://calend.ly/tchang2. Look forward to hearing from you!

review: Would be better of if they just wrapped a browser. Updating a page results in random words showing up on random places on a page. Just thinking about tables crashees the app. Hosted Confluence is already an average quality app, but you guys managed to make it worse.
ras4vb: Hey there! I'm Steph with the development team. Thank you for your feedback - we greatly appreciate it! Any chance you'd be willing to chat with us for 30 mins so we can learn more? Let us know at confluence-mobile@atlassian.com.

review: Very easy to use above else. Creating blogs and pages instead of emails has made the collaboration easier replacing multiple follow ups and losing details in the email thread. Do give it a try and it is awesome once you get used to its features and nuances.

An inability to easily change dates within a page is a huge negative for me, tapping on a date when editing a page should show a date picker, it currently does nothing... This is a must have... Apart from that, it seems sound

Searching is difficult and making a hyperlink (!) is impossible on the mobile app. The performance is legendarily slow. The help content doesn't even mention mobile apps. I don't understand how a knowledgebase cannot support this. If my company wouldn't force me to use this product, I would never switch away from Notion or Coda. It's apparent that Atlassian is a dinosaur company that has too many loose ties across touchpoints, not being able to handle them coherently.
ras4vb: Hey there! My name is Steph with the development team, and we're happy to announce that linking is now be possible with version 2.4.11. Let us know what you think! We'd love to improve, so if you've got additional feedback, let us know at confluence-mobile@atlassian.com

review: great tool for my personal notes because i can search full text and easily navigate to the content i created

I changed page a lot, but save button disappeared, only "go back", when I tap, it discarded all the changes. I copied them before going back but they are copied without images and links. There is no way to change, add or copy a link.
ras4vb: Hi there! I'm Steph from the development team and am sorry to hear about your experience. Would you open to spending some time to chat with us about your feedback? Please let us know at confluence-mobile@atlassian.com

review: While useful, also quite minimal. Lacks support, for instance, for viewing a user's assigned tasks, or for viewing the formatting of v2 editor pages. Searching also seems hit or miss.
Ok to check quick updates but it's not something you can relay on. App is very unpredictable. It's ofter freeze, you can't open pages and all.
ras4vb: Hey Ketan! Thank you for writing a review. Sometimes, the app may be slow but such instances are rare. If the issue happens often, please contact us at confluence-mobile@atlassian.com and let us know what's not working for you. We'll investigate and see if we can make the app better for you.

review: Probably the best Atlassian product I used.
Tap to load components does not load quickly.. Need to wait for indefinite minutes even though its a mobile app
I find the app very useful for writing and documenting my work.
Confluence app is good and helpful. Just one note - voting polls not working on the app. Polls don't display properly. Other than that, so far so good.
I can't edit anything as the edit view is just a muddled mess with text overlapping, some of the page structure does not show properly. Not really useful.
No use unless you have the cloud version. We host confluence ourselves as need to keep data within the UK. Would be nice if self hosted could also be accessed from the app.

Keeps inserting extra lines in pages and the cursor jumps to different locations constantly. This is unusable on a Galaxy S20. Maybe instead of investing in artificially inflating your star rating with generic feedback. You could re-allocate the hours into fixing the app...
ras4vb: Please check if you have Grammarly enabled. Grammarly + Samsung keyboard has issues and Samsung has issued an update for their keyboard. For more details on this issue please see: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Grammarly-Issue-for-Confluence-amp-Jira-Mobile-Samsung-Users/ba-p/1997726

review: I give 3 stars to the mobile app because it's incomplete. You guys should add "Dashboards" and "Issues and Filters". Until then i can't use this app to its full potential.

Hi, 5 stars from long term user and fan of your solution set (confluence, jira, bitbucket). However, recently I noticed issues when browsing through our WIP knowledge base in a new company - on mobile app, browsing page through TOC that is assembled of multiple sub-page chunks via include has really messed up scrolling. Could that be fixed please, or is there any workaround? I'm on Android, didnt try on iOS. Contact me at martin(dot)r(at)manifesto(dot)city for more details if needed.
Cannot see content of excerpt macro, even if there is a button telling me to tap for content. Very sluggish in general, very noisy notification default.
Just had to rewrite my comment 5 times (not kidding). The comment would either disappear when clicking the post button or the app would randomly navigate to notifications. Bad experience.

I'm hesitant to give more than 3 stars now as I'm still new to the app. Fould one issue though, switching to light mode theme doesn't change the theme to light and remains on dark (my OS is on dark mode) even after killing the app and starting it again.
ras4vb: Sorry about that! Unfortunately on MIUI 12, it has implemented a forced dark theme mode, where if you set the system to dark, the OS will try to force dark theme on all apps, and so you're right, that feature may not work as expected for that case.
